zooming (actions)

The programmer can indicate at which level of detail a description of an action should appear by adding an integer immediately after the opening ‘//$’ of an annotation. Higher numbers indicate a finer level of detail; the zoom level is 0 by default, corresponding to the coarsest level of detail. This makes different zoom levels possible in visualizing the HTML output. [implemented zoom levels 0-2]

annotation

...
//$0 action 1
code
//$1 action 1.1
code
//$1 action 1.2
code
//$0 action 2
...

0 is optional, corresponds to the main actions.

representation in the diagram

Zoom level 0 Zoom level 1

*Note: both zoom level diagrams will be generated. Future versions of Flowgen could use an interactive zoom, for example on mouse click

examples

int class::activity_method(){

int a;      

//$ action 1
int b=1;
int c=2;
//$1 action 1.1
std::cout << "do"<< b << endl;
//$1 action 1.2
std::cout << "do"<< c << endl;

//$0 action 2
std::cin >> a;

return 0;
}
Zoom level 0 Zoom level 1
